title: Time, Eternity, and Eschatology in Ibn Arabi's Thought

questions.question: What is Ibn Arabi's concept of 'perpetual creation' called in Arabic?
choices: Al-khalq al-jadid
Al-a'yan al-thabita
Tajalli
Barzakh
questions.answer: Al-khalq al-jadid

questions.question: According to Ibn Arabi, what is the nature of existence?
choices: Static and unchanging
Constantly in flux
Purely illusory
Eternally fixed
questions.answer: Constantly in flux

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi view the relationship between time and divine names?
choices: Time is independent of divine names
Each moment represents a unique configuration of divine self-manifestation
Divine names exist outside of time
Time controls the expression of divine names
questions.answer: Each moment represents a unique configuration of divine self-manifestation

questions.question: What are the levels of time in Ibn Arabi's cosmology?
choices: Past, present, and future
Linear, circular, and spiral
Divine, cosmic, and human
Eternal, temporal, and imaginal
questions.answer: Divine, cosmic, and human

questions.question: What is the highest level of time in Ibn Arabi's cosmology?
choices: Human time
Cosmic time
Divine time
Eternal time
questions.answer: Divine time

questions.question: What are 'eternal archetypes' called in Arabic?
choices: Al-khalq al-jadid
Al-a'yan al-thabita
Tajalli
Alam al-mithal
questions.answer: Al-a'yan al-thabita

questions.question: Where do eternal archetypes exist according to Ibn Arabi?
choices: In the physical universe
In human consciousness
In God's mind
In the imaginal world
questions.answer: In God's mind

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi interpret traditional Islamic eschatology?
choices: He rejects it entirely
He accepts it literally
He offers esoteric interpretations emphasizing spiritual dimensions
He views it as purely symbolic with no real meaning
questions.answer: He offers esoteric interpretations emphasizing spiritual dimensions

questions.question: What is the 'imaginal world' in Ibn Arabi's thought?
choices: The physical universe
An intermediate realm between physical and spiritual planes
The world of dreams
The afterlife
questions.answer: An intermediate realm between physical and spiritual planes

questions.question: What is the function of the 'imaginal world' in Ibn Arabi's eschatology?
choices: It is where souls are judged
It serves as a bridge between life and death
It is where eternal archetypes reside
It is the source of divine names
questions.answer: It serves as a bridge between life and death

questions.question: What is the 'barzakh' in Ibn Arabi's thought?
choices: A physical barrier between heaven and hell
The Day of Judgment
A liminal space between different states of being
The eternal present
questions.answer: A liminal space between different states of being

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi view the relationship between the present moment and the afterlife?
choices: They are completely separate
The afterlife is simply a continuation of the present
The afterlife interpenetrates the present moment
The present moment is an illusion created by the afterlife
questions.answer: The afterlife interpenetrates the present moment

questions.question: What does Ibn Arabi's concept of 'perpetual creation' suggest about the nature of reality?
choices: Reality is static and unchanging
Reality is constantly being renewed
Reality is an illusion
Reality exists only in the mind
questions.answer: Reality is constantly being renewed

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi's view of time challenge linear notions of temporality?
choices: It suggests time moves backwards
It proposes time is circular
It presents time as multidimensional and fluid
It argues that time doesn't exist
questions.answer: It presents time as multidimensional and fluid

questions.question: What is 'tajalli' in Ibn Arabi's thought?
choices: The Day of Judgment
Divine self-disclosure
The imaginal world
The human soul
questions.answer: Divine self-disclosure

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi relate the concept of 'tajalli' to time?
choices: Tajalli occurs outside of time
Tajalli is the source of time
Time is a manifestation of ongoing tajalli
Tajalli and time are unrelated concepts
questions.answer: Time is a manifestation of ongoing tajalli

questions.question: According to Ibn Arabi, what is the relationship between the soul and eternity?
choices: The soul is mortal and temporary
The soul is eternal and pre-existent
The soul comes into existence at birth
The soul ceases to exist after death
questions.answer: The soul is eternal and pre-existent

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi view physical death?
choices: As the end of existence
As a transition in the soul's journey
As an illusion
As the beginning of true life
questions.answer: As a transition in the soul's journey

questions.question: What does Ibn Arabi suggest about the nature of paradise and hell?
choices: They are physical locations
They don't exist
They are states of consciousness
They are temporary conditions
questions.answer: They are states of consciousness

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi's concept of time relate to divine attributes?
choices: Time is independent of divine attributes
Each moment manifests different divine attributes
Divine attributes exist outside of time
Time controls the expression of divine attributes
questions.answer: Each moment manifests different divine attributes

questions.question: What does Ibn Arabi mean by the 'renewal of creation'?
choices: The universe is recreated every few billion years
God creates new species regularly
The universe is continuously recreated at every moment
Creation is renewed only on the Day of Judgment
questions.answer: The universe is continuously recreated at every moment

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi's view of eschatology differ from more literal interpretations?
choices: He denies the existence of an afterlife
He sees eschatological events as purely symbolic
He emphasizes the spiritual dimensions of eschatological concepts
He argues that eschatology only applies to non-believers
questions.answer: He emphasizes the spiritual dimensions of eschatological concepts

questions.question: What role does the 'imaginal world' play in Ibn Arabi's understanding of dreams and visions?
choices: It has no relation to dreams and visions
It is the source of all dreams and visions
It is where dreams and visions are interpreted
It is a realm where spiritual realities can take symbolic form
questions.answer: It is a realm where spiritual realities can take symbolic form

questions.question: According to Ibn Arabi, what is the nature of human perception of time?
choices: It is completely accurate
It is an illusion
It is influenced by spiritual states
It is unrelated to divine reality
questions.answer: It is influenced by spiritual states

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi view the concept of free will in relation to his idea of perpetual creation?
choices: Free will is an illusion
Free will exists independently of divine creation
Free will is part of the ongoing divine creative act
Free will only exists in the afterlife
questions.answer: Free will is part of the ongoing divine creative act

questions.question: What does Ibn Arabi suggest about the nature of the 'Day of Judgment'?
choices: It is a literal future event
It is a myth with no basis in reality
It is an ongoing process of self-evaluation
It only applies to certain individuals
questions.answer: It is an ongoing process of self-evaluation

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi's concept of time relate to spiritual practice?
choices: Spiritual practice is unrelated to time
Time hinders spiritual practice
Each moment is an opportunity for spiritual realization
Spiritual practice can only occur outside of time
questions.answer: Each moment is an opportunity for spiritual realization

questions.question: What does Ibn Arabi suggest about the relationship between divine eternity and created time?
choices: They are completely separate
Created time is an illusion within divine eternity
Divine eternity is composed of infinite moments of created time
Created time interpenetrates divine eternity
questions.answer: Created time interpenetrates divine eternity

questions.question: How does Ibn Arabi's view of time and eternity influence his understanding of prophecy?
choices: Prophecy is unrelated to time and eternity
Prophets exist outside of time
Prophetic knowledge transcends temporal limitations
Prophecy is limited to predicting future events
questions.answer: Prophetic knowledge transcends temporal limitations

questions.question: What is the significance of the 'eternal now' in Ibn Arabi's thought?
choices: It refers to the present moment in human time
It is a state of timelessness in which all moments coexist
It is the time experienced after death
It is an illusion created by human perception
questions.answer: It is a state of timelessness in which all moments coexist
